column4: is there a way to via SSH configure ubuntu to run in text mode only on reboot?
you don't want gdm to startup?
if you read /etc/init/gdm.conf it hints that you can add "text" to your kernel line in grub to have gdm not start
edit /etc/default/grub and modify GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT, run update-grub, update the existing entries in /boot/grub/grub.cfg too
